features: ULTRA SLIM: Ciarra range hood with 3.94’ low profile, extremely space saving. Great for condos and apartments.
USER-FRIENDLY DESIGN: Range hood 30 inch with mechanical push button for convenient control. Quiet operation, 6.5 Sones max at the highest speed.
SUPERIOR FILTRATION: Ductless range hood with 5-layers mesh filters, trap cooking grease and oil with ease, preventing smells and odors spreading in your kitchen.
CONVERTIBLLE VENTILATION MODE: This slim range hood can be converted with ducted or ductless. Please operate with the optional purchase of CACF006 carbon filter for recirculating.
2 YEAR WARRANTY: 30 inch kitchen vent hood provide 2 year limited warranty against any defects.
body.description: AWS75918B KITCHEN HOOD 30 inch ductless range hood made with premium 430 grade stainless steel, with a long lifespan. 200 CFM suction, keep your kitchen fresh and clean, so you can enjoy the time preparing delicious meals for your family and friends. 2 x 3 watt LED lights 3 x 5-layers aluminum mesh filters Top vent hole: 4.8 inches. Rear vent hole: 5.9 x 2.56 inches Voltage: 110V-120V/60Hz Power of Motor: 100W Product weight: 12.02lb Product dimension: 29.76 (W) x 19.68 (D) x 3.94 (H) inches

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: CIARRA range hood with modern design to fit a variety of kitchen. Expect cooking and cleaning experiences that make life easier, brighten up your kitchen, and protect your health. AWS75918B KITCHEN HOOD 30 inch ductless range hood made with premium 430 grade stainless steel, with a long lifespan. 200 CFM suction, keep your kitchen fresh and clean, so you can enjoy the time preparing delicious meals for your family and friends. 2 x 3 watt LED lights 3 x 5-layers aluminum mesh filters Top vent hole: 4.8 inches. Rear vent hole: 5.9 x 2.56 inches Voltage: 110V-120V/60Hz Power of Motor: 100W Product weight: 12.02lb Product dimension: 29.76 (W) x 19.68 (D) x 3.94 (H) inches

Mesh Filters Our slim range hood with 5-layer aluminum mesh filters can perfectly filter out the greases that might occurred from cooking. Ensuring an efficient ventilation. LED Lights Our under cabinet range hood with replaceable LED lights are energy efficient and cost saving. More than 20000 hours life time. Lighting up your cooking space for better visibility. Mechanical Push Button Control Easy to operate with quick response. It's as easy as the push the button to control the suction power, lights and 3 fan speeds.

Space Saving Design This ciarra range hood has only 3.94 inches height which is extremely slim, also it is perfect for small condos and apartments. You can seamlessly integrate this ultra slim range hood with any kitchen cabinet. 3-Speed Levels Low-Speed for air ventilation with barely no noise; Medium-Speed for your everyday cooking purpose; High-Speed for stir-fry or cooking with lots of smoke and grease produced. 3 Ventilation Holes Ducted operation, there are 2 venting ways, vertical (top venting) an exhaust pipe is needed, and horizontal (rear venting), you need to use tool remove the rectangular cover before using the rear venting. Ductless operation, the front venting hole is available.

Extraction (Ducted Mode) Rear venting (horizontal) using rectangular 5.9 x 2.56inches damper. The vent hood can be ducted though the rear ventilation hole.Top venting(vertical) using 4.8inches round damper. Install the exhaust pipe which is not included in the package, the range hood can be ducted through the top ventilation hole.Tips: remember toturn the adjuster (on the motor housing) to ducted position. Re-circulation (Ductless Mode) Install the CACF006 carbon filter (sold separately). The smells and odors can be filtered and the clean airflow can be vent through the front ventilation hole. (exhaust pipe is not required.)Tips: remember to put on the outlet cover, and turn the adjuster (on the motor housing) to ductless position.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great but beware: This is not preset for hardwiring
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. The first thing buyers should be aware of, which is NOT listed anywhere I could see in the listing, is that the unit has a three prong plug. If you're building your kitchen from scratch, wiring is easier because of the location choices of hikes in the wall.Otherwise, if you're like me, and replacing your hood unit, I would have liked for the company to note whether it was bare wire or plugged. The reason being, if there's something wrong after install, and you need to send it back for replacement, they might refuse if you have cut the plug off. That said:If you're not comfortable with bare wiring/electricity, get a handyman to do this for you. I'm not an electrician, but don't mind dabbling. It's actually extremely easy to do. Here are the steps:1. I made sure to plug it in and test the fan modes and lighting before snipping the three prong plug off.2. Turn off the breaker to the oven hood in your electrical switch box. DO NOT SKIP THIS PART OR YOU CAN DIE.3. Now that you're safe to work, cut the three prong plug off of the power cable. Take a razor and slice the black shielding. About 2 inches long. This will expose 3 separate wires. They will be black, white and green.4. The BLACK wire is the "HOT" or "live" wire. Green is ground and white is neutral, which takes any unused electricity back to the circuit box. These colors will match up to the wires coming out of your wall.Basically, strip each wire so you have about an inch worth of copper, twist said copper so that it is all taught and not frayed. Then match the like colors and wrap the copper wire you just twisted, around the thick bare wire from the wall.5. Put electrical tape around the wound wires, but not too much. About 3 wrap arounds. Put a wire cap on the joined and taped wires and twist the cap on until it is snug. Repeat for the other two.6. Put excess power cable back in the wall.Done. Pretty much. Mine is ductless, and I chose to use the top screw holes rather than the back facing ones because I didn't want to drill into my tile. My previous unit was screwed to the top, so I knew that the same screws were just the right size.If you do want to drill into tile, make sure to have the proper drill bit type. Probably carbide. (Masonry)I did have my wife hold the unit up for me until I was able to get 2 screws in to where I marked the holes with a pencil and drilled a pilot hole, and highly advise you also get someone to give you a hand as well. Just a PITA otherwise.Works great. Lights are bright, fan isn't crazy loud and looks great.I would maybe take half a star off for the fact that there's no information about the wiring, but I'm not even sure if that's fair considering it's not necessarily in terms of product usage, useful. As far as usage goes five stars so far.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Replaced an old range hood with this new one. Extremely easy to install, 6 screws and plug it in. Very quiet, good quality, and attractive. A big win!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars works well and looks geat!
reviews.reviewText: works as described and the convertible option is what I was looking for. Next summer I will vent it to the exterior. I want to suggest that the packaging be beefed up a bit because the first one arrived with a huge dent to the top and had to be returned. I am happy with the overall product and function. I did order the charcoal filters as recommended for recirculating option.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really nice low-profile replacement hood.
reviews.reviewText: Replaced a sheet metal fan that looked really bad. This one is a great looking one. Fan speeds are great, light bright, etc.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: We needed a new stainless steel one. We do not have any type of built in venting system. This one vents through the vent in the front into the kitchen. Has 3 filters & a carbon filter. It’s very nice looking. Easy to operate and blends in with the new stainless steel cooktop. Easy to install. Worth the money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than my last range hood!
reviews.reviewText: The lighting is wonderful and having three speeds is great. It’s not very noisy at all and works well. Order extra filters when you purchase because one set of filters is not washable but you can get a set of two for about $25. I do love the look of this range hood and performance of the exhaust fan.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars VERY THIN LESS THAN 4 INCHED HIGH
reviews.reviewText: GREAT IF YOU HAVE LOW CABINETS OVER THE STOVE.COMES WITH TWO WHITE LED LIGHTS AND THREE SPEED FAN THAT BLOWS UP NOT IN YOUR FACE IF YOU USE INDOOR FILTERING.COMES WITH THREE GREASE FILTER SECTIONS.YOU HAVE TO BUY FILTERS FOR INDOOR USE BUT THEY COME IN A TWO PACK.COMES WITH PRE INSTALLED STANDARD GROUNDED OUTLET PLUG OR CHANGE IT FOR HARD WIRE.VERY PLEASED

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Lighting is good
reviews.reviewText: You have to use top mount holes. If you plan on using just the back mounting holes it will sag because metal is to flimsy. The metal scuffs and scratches easy. The filters are nice and easy to take off and on. Fan speed 1 and 2 are quit 3 is noisy but not overly bad. I needed a ventless hood this one can with a block off cap which was easy to put on. The charcoal filter that is recommended to use with ventless hood does not come with it so you have to buy separately but is easy to install. It is a slim hood if you need more clearance. You do need a cabinet above it to secure it to. Comes with a long cord that plugs right into an outlet.
